title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/advanced-search-plus
name: Advance Search Plus
description: Adds some powerfull search tools
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
* Important: ''No browser reload'' needed * Change the default "Advanced Search" tiddler * Adds the "Advanced Search" tab to the right sidebar * Replaces the default search option with an icon * Adds a "new search tab" button to the advanced search function * Allows to pin existing search settings to a new tab ---- ''Important'': This plugin modifies several core templates
    <$list filter="[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/advanced-search-plus]plugintiddlers[]prefix[$:/core/]] $:/AdvancedSearch">
  • <$link to=<>><>

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/bundler
name: Bundler
description: Simple UI to create tiddler bundles
author: pmario
readme:
\define baseURL() https://wikilabs.github.io/editions/bundler/# \define link(text tid) <$link to={{{ [<__tid__>slugify[]] }}} ><<__text__>> \define extLink(text tid) ] [<__tid__>slugify[]] +[join[]] }}} rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><<__text__>> \define .xL(text tid) \whitespace trim <$let macro={{{ [<__tid__>slugify[]is[tiddler]then[link]else[extLink]] }}}> <$macrocall $name=<> text=<<__text__>> tid=<<__tid__>> /> \end \define openControlBundlesTab() <$action-setfield $tiddler="$:/state/tab-1749438307" text="$:/plugins/wikilabs/bundler/ui/ControlPanel/bundler-config"/> <$action-navigate $to="$:/ControlPanel"/> \end \define rightSidebarBundlesTab() <$action-setfield $tiddler="$:/state/tab/sidebar--595412856" text="$:/plugins/wikilabs/bundler/ui/Bundles"/> \end ! ~ReadMe * Documentation and more can be found at: https://wikilabs.github.io/editions/bundler * The position of the "Bundles" tab can be selected in the <$button actions=<> class="tc-btn-invisible tc-tiddlylink">~$:/ControlPanel : Bundles tab * There are 2 version of bundles ** <<.xL "Bundle Lists" "doc-bundle-lists">> ... Enabled by default ** <<.xL "Filtered Bundles" "doc-filtered-bundles">> ... Have to be activated by the user * The filter examples can be live tested, clicking on the number besides the "export button" * The Bundler can bundled itself and other plugins into a bundle. See: <<.xL "comment-self.bundle" "comment-self.bundle">> * You can create several "selections". Those combinations are persistently stored for reuse. * Bundle lists can be built up, over time. Just as the TW evolves * The "Enable Import Bundle" option lets you collect / log imported tiddlers and create a new bundle, for future use. * It's easy to add the bundle configuration to the bundle itself eg: ** If the bundle is named: `tagged-test.bundle`, the filter can look like this: `[tag[test]] tagged-test.bundle` * Have a closer look at the ~$:/ControlPanel: Bundles tab for more [[settings|$:/plugins/wikilabs/bundler/ui/ControlPanel/bundler-config]]. * This plugin only works with TW >= 5.1.18 since we use the "subfilter" operator which has been added in 5.1.18 --- ''Important:'' This plugin modifies the following core module and / or templates
    <$list filter="[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/bundler]plugintiddlers[]prefix[$:/core/]] ~[[-- none --]] ">
  • <$link to=<>><>

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet
name: Cheatsheet TW WikiText
description: A compact wikitext syntax overview
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
This plugin adds the [[Wikitext Cheatsheet]] overview to your wiki.

''Cheatsheet Settings''

This plugin adds 2 new "Show Wikitext Cheatsheet" buttons and an editor-shortcut to your wiki

* A "Cheatsheet" button is added as a "page button"
* A "Cheatsheet" button is added to the edit toolbars .. Shortcut <kbd>F1</kbd>

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/click-effect
name: Click Effect
description: A simple mouse-button click effect
author: pmario
readme: ! Basics This plugin shows a little "click animation" if the left mouse button is released ! Settings Th current setting is: ''{{$:/config/clickEffect}}'' | Setting | Description |h |<$radio field="text" tiddler="$:/config/clickEffect" value="clickEffect"> Click Effect |A little click animation is shown at the cursor position | |<$radio field="text" tiddler="$:/config/clickEffect" value="pulse"> Element Pulse |The html-element, that is clicked is highlighted | |<$radio field="text" tiddler="$:/config/clickEffect" value="no"> Off |No click-animaiton is shown| ---- ''Important'': This plugin modifies several core modules <$list filter="[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/click-effect]plugintiddlers[]prefix[$:/core/]]"><$link to=<>><>

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/field-editor
name: Multiline Field Editor
description: Side by side multiline field editor
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
\define createFieldSwitcherElement() <$action-createtiddler $basetitle="$:/config/wikilabs/field-editor/" $template="$:/config/wikilabs/field-editor/text" tags="$:/tags/wikilabs/fieldswitcher" description="Add a short description text here and replace the icon below" icon="{{$:/core/images/spiral}}" $overwrite="yes" text="yourFieldName"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-edit-tiddler" $param="$:/config/wikilabs/field-editor/"/> \end !! About This plugin adds a field selector above the text editor and a new button that allows you to edit different fields in multiline edit mode side by side !! Video See: [[Video]] !! Create a new Field Switcher Element To create a new field-switcher button click the button below and follow the instructions. <$button actions=<> > Create a new Field Switcher Element !! Toggle Field label By default a label is shown, when the tiddler shows a filed different to the "text" field. <$checkbox tiddler="$:/config/wikilabs/show-field-label" field=text checked="yes" unchecked="no" default="yes"> Show Field Label !!! ''Imporant'' * If you use an icon it has to be covered in double curly braces eg: `{{$:/core/images/globe}}`. * Icons can be found at the [[Image Gallery Examples|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Icon%20Gallery:%5B%5BIcon%20Gallery%5D%5D%20%5B%5BLanguageGallery%20Example%5D%5D]] * [["TW Icons" by morosanuae|https://tiddlywiki.com/#%22TW%20Icons%22%20by%20morosanuae]] !! Existing Field Switcher Elements <> !! Dependencies This plugin depends on the: [[Field Visibility Plugin|https://wikilabs.github.io/editions/field-visibility]] !! Modified Core Tiddles This plugin changes the following core tiddlers:
    <$list filter="[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/field-editor]plugintiddlers[]prefix[$:/core/]] [[$:/config/ui/EditTemplate]] ">
  • <$link to=<>><>
''Important:'' More information about `$:/config/ui/EditTemplate` and the edit cascades can be found at [[TiddlyWiki Docs|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Story%20Tiddler%20Template%20Cascade:%5B%5BStory%20Tiddler%20Template%20Cascade%5D%5D%20%24%3A%2Fcore%2Fui%2FControlPanel%2FStoryTiddler%20%5B%5BHidden%20Setting%3A%20ViewTemplate%20and%20EditTemplate%5D%5D%20Cascades%20%5B%5BEdit%20Template%20Body%20Cascade%5D%5D]] The full list of tiddlers in the plugin can be found at: [[$:/plugins/wikilabs/field-editor]] '': contents'' tab.

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/info-session
name: Info Session
description: Info button, with session persistent open/closed status
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
! Deprecated

A similar function is part of the TW core since v5.1.14 see: [[ControlPanel : Settings|https://tiddlywiki.com/#%24%3A%2Fcore%2Fui%2FControlPanel%2FSettings%2FInfoPanelMode]]

! Description

* This plugin provides a tiddler info button, with a persistent open/close status ''for one browser session''.
* The status is saved in a system "$:/state/popup" variable. 
** This means, if you reload the TW, the status is gone, sice they are not stored by default!

''Important:''

* This plugin changes the core tiddler: $:/core/ui/Buttons/info

----

If you want persistent state variables, you need to ''add'' the "persistent-states" plugin ''and'' modify the ~ViewTemplate. The ''slant-01 theme" provides this functionality.

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/info-tagmap
name: Info TagMap
description: Adds a Tag-Map tab to the tiddler info section
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
This plugin adds a new tab to the tiddler info section. It's a multi column list of all tiddler tags plus all tagged tiddlers.

This plugin doesn't change any core templates.

The code below can be copied into the tag tiddlers.

```
All tiddlers tagged: {{!!title}}

<<list-links filter:"[tag{!!title}]">>
```

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/keyvalues
name: Key Values
description: improve data-tiddler handling
author: pmario
readme:
! ''keyvalues'' Operator

The "keyvalues" operator only works with DataTiddlers. Non data-tiddlers will be ignored!

The <<.op keyvalues>> operator uses an extended syntax that permits multiple fields and flags to be passed:

```
[keyvalues:<field list>:<separator>:<flag>[<operand>]]
```

* ''field list'': an ordered, comma delimited list. Either `key`, `value` or both
** defaults to `key,value` if blank
* ''separator'': a separator string used to combine the output string
** defaults to `: ` = `<colon><space>` if blank <small>(new since V2.1.0)</small>
** If a space is needed, use: ` `
** If a colon `:` is needed, use: `:`
* ''flag'': `usekey`, `usevalue` or `useboth`
** (defaults to `usekey` if blank)
** only 1 flag is allowed. The first one will be used
* ''operand'': filter operand

The following example lists both the <<.field key>> and the <<.field value>>. It uses the string <<.op -xx->> as a separator between key and value. It uses the regexp operand: <<.op digit-pattern>> to filter by the <<.field key>> 

```
<$set name="digit-pattern" value="[0][3-9]:">
[keyvalues:key,value:-xx-:usekey<digit-pattern>]
```

The available flags are:

* ''usekey'' - the <<.field key>> will be used to filter the output. The `<operand>` contains a regexp filter
* ''usevalue'' - the <<.field value>> will be used to filter the output. The `<operand>` contains a regexp filter
* ''useboth'' - the <<.field key>>, the <<.field seperator>> and <<.field value>> will be used to filter the output. The `<operand>` contains a regexp filter

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/markdown-it
description: Markdown parser (Commonmark compatible)
name: Markdown It
author: pmario
readme:
The plugin version mirrors the markdown-it library version!

This is a WikiLabs plugin for parsing Markdown text, based on the [[markdown-it|https://markdown-it.github.io/]] project.

It is completely self-contained, and doesn't need an Internet connection in order to work. It works both in the browser and under Node.js.

[[Source code can be found here!|https://github.com/wikilabs/plugins/tree/master/wikilabs]]

readme:

[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/palette-manager/license]]

!! Video

Youtube will start collecting user-info, if you play the video!

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/20mQwPuMv6w" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Feedback will be welcome at: [[to get feedback at Talk-TiddlyWiki|https://talk.tiddlywiki.org/t/palette-manager-feature-complete-preview/5095]]

! Overview

This plugin is an ''preview'' plugin, that should be implemented into the TW core in the future.

* You can open it using the [[$:/PaletteManager]] ... where the previews look a bit different as if you open it with the 
* $:/ControlPanel --> Appearence --> Palette -> <kbd>show editor</kbd> button

! Important

This plugin overwrites and adds the following system tiddlers:

|Shadow Tiddler |Reason to change it atm |h
|$:/PaletteManager |This is needed to get the new UI as shown in the image below |

|New |Description |h
|$:/PaletteManager/preview |Contains the whole preview code, which is `\import`ed to $:/PaletteManager |

The full list of plugin tiddlers can be seen at: $:/plugins/wikilabs/palette-manager -> content tab

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/persistent-states
description: Makes all state tiddlers persistent
name: Persistent States
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
! Overview

This plugin saves all $:/state/ tiddlers and creates a simple UI, to remove them manually.

! Important

This plugin in meant to be used for single-file wikis. It does ''not'' work in a "multi user" environment, since it will overwrite other users states if they are synchronized. 

This plugin changes the following core tiddlers:

* $:/config/SyncFilter
* $:/config/SaverFilter

! Simple UI

[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/ui/persistent-states]]

{{$:/plugins/wikilabs/ui/persistent-states}}

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/pragma-comment
name: Pragma Comment
description: Add possibility to add 'pragma comments'
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
! Deprecated

A similar function is part of the TW core since V5.2.0 See: https://tiddlywiki.com/#HTML%20in%20WikiText : Pragma Comments

! Pragma Comment

The following lines will not create a parse-tree element and it will not interrupt the "pragma parser". So comments can be placed outside of macro definitions, which is much faster during macro execution.

```
\\ comment comes here till the end of the line
\\ comments like this are fast since they are ignored and the result is cached!

\define test()
\\ This comment is as slow as the next line
<!-- HTML comment -->
\end

\\ The whole definition is deactivated. .... Works well for a few lines of code!
\\define test()
\\end

\\ if you have big junks of code, it's easier to rename the macro eg: testXXXX() as shown below!
\define testXXXX()
x
x
x
\end
```

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/space-space-newline
name: Space Space Newline
description: Adds a new rule to create hard linebreaks
readme:
Adds a wikitext rule to create hard linebreaks with `<space><space><newLine>` or `<space><space><backslash>`

```
There are 2 spaces and 1 linebreak at the end of this line  
So we should see 2 lines
```

>There are 2 spaces and 1 linebreak at the end of this line  
So we should see 2 lines

---

```
There are 2 spaces and a backslash at the end of this line  \
So we should see 2 lines
```

>There are 2 spaces and a backslash at the end of this line  \
So we should see 2 lines

---

```
If you want to have a visible backslash at the end of this line \  
You need to add 2 spaces at the end of the line
```

>If you want to have a visible backslash at the end of this line \  
You need to add 2 spaces after the backslash


It's possible to manipulate the rules behaviour with:

`\rules only ssnl`  
`\rules excpet ssnl`

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/tocP
name: tocP
description: Parent Based - Table of Contents
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
This plugin contains several "Table of Content" macros, that have the same parameters as the core toc macro. The main difference is, that it doesn't use tags to create the TOC scructure. It uses a "parent" field in so called "child - tiddlers". ''Detailed Documentation'' More details about this plugin can be found at: https://wikilabs.github.io/editions/tocP More plugins, themes and editions can be found at: https://wikilabs.github.io/ ''Important'' These macros are intended to be "drop in replacement" of the core macros. ... They have the exact same parameter names. Instead of "parent" it still uses "tag" as the first parameter. ''Usage'' ```
<>
<>
<>
<>
<>
<>
``` ''For Streams .. WIP'' ```
<$set name="tv-wikilinks" value="no"> <>
``` ''streamTextTemplate'': is just a `<$transclude mode=block/>` ''viewField'': usually needs to be `text` if a template is used ```
<$set name="tv-wikilinks" value="no"> <>
``` ''Simple Configuration'' * Enable / Disable the inline "New Child" button ** {{$:/plugins/wikilabs/tocP/toggle-new-child-button}} ''Known Problems'' * The "tabbed" versions don't show the "New Child" buttons * Color customisation isn't possible atm

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/trails
name: Trails
description: Show a breadcrumbs trail to visualize the context
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
This plugin allows you to use 3 different responsive trail configurations !! trail CSS Options If the user changes the global font-size and / or line-height in the theme to higher values, it will be needed to adjust the breadcrumb settings accordingly. The following parameters can be used to dynamically calculate the "arrow shape". For small screens the graphical arrow shape is replaced by plain text. * $:/config/wl/trails/height ... Defines the line-height used for the trail arrow elements. Defaults to: 22 * $:/config/wl/trails/fontSize ... Defines the default CSS font-size setting. Defaults to: 15 * $:/config/wl/trails/paddingBottom ... Can be used to increase the bottom padding of the arrows. Defaults to: 3 * $:/config/wl/trails/paddingTop ... Can be used to change the top padding of the arrows. Defaults to: 3 * $:/config/wl/trails/showArrows ... If set to "yes" the trail "arrows" are shown. Any other value shows the "plain text" version, independent of the screen width. Defaults to: yes !! Global Mode Setting $:/config/wl/trails/filterMode ... defines the default "mode" the trail macro uses for the "filter syntax" related documentation !! Usage ``` <$macrocall $name="trail" stop="Filters" mode={{$:/config/wl/trails/filterMode}}/> ``` !! Settings {{$:/plugins/wikilabs/trails/config}} !! Important ''This plugin modifies a core module and templates''
    <$list filter="[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/trail]plugintiddlers[]prefix[$:/core/]]" emptyMessage="none">
  • <$link to=<>><>

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link
description: Enhances the prettylink-parser
name: Uni-Link
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
\define createExampleTiddlers() <$button> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="tiddler-with-caption" caption="Short Caption"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="tiddler-with-subtitle" subtitle="Tiddler With Subtitle Only Defined"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="tiddler-with-subtitle-and-caption" subtitle="Tiddler With Subtitle And Caption - using subtitle" caption="capt.ion"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="tiddler-with-alias" aliases="alias" caption="alias-caption" subtitle="alias-subtitle" my-field="alias my-field"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="test-links" text={{$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/backlinks-template!!text}}/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="This is a Test" text="This tiddler is used as an example for [[uni-link-search]]"/> Create "uni-link" example tiddlers! \end \define deleteExampleTiddlers() <$button> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="tiddler-with-caption"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="tiddler-with-subtitle"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="tiddler-with-subtitle-and-caption"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="tiddler-with-alias"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="test-links"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="This is a Test"/> Delete example tiddlers! \end ! Important This plugin modifies a core module and / or templates
    <$list filter="[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link]plugintiddlers[]prefix[$:/core/]] -[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link]plugintiddlers[]suffix[/aliasify]]">
  • <$link to=<>><>
''This uni-link version is compatible with ~TiddlyWiki >= V5.1.22'' If you need to use it with TW <= V5.1.21 you'll need to use an older version, which is available at: https://wikilabs.github.io/#GettingStarted ! Video * See: https://wikilabs.github.io/editions/uni-link/#GettingStarted ! Uni-link <<< * A new wikitext parsing rule, that calls the global [["uni-link" macro|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/uni-link-macro]], instead of referencing the tiddler name. * It substitues the following tiddler fields: ''subtitle'', ''caption'' and ''title''. The $:/ControlPanel contains a new tab, that lets you define the behaviour of the uni-link macro. Default is ''title''. So there is no difference between the default setting of the plugin and the default behaviour in unmodified ~TiddlyWiki. <<< ! Uni-link Search <<< `[[case insensitive title|??]]` will do a ''literal, case-insensitive'' title search. It will return ''the first'' tiddler it finds. ''Examples'': |`[[This is a Test|??]]`|[[this is a test|??]]| |`[[doesn't exist|??]]`|[[doesn't exist|??]]| ''Warning'' * uni-link V2.1.0 does ''not'' contain a "relink plugin" addOn! * So if you change the tiddler name, those links won't be changed! <<< ! Alias <<< * Alias Link Syntax ** `[[anything|?]]` ... link to the tiddler that contains the alias: `anything` ** `[[anything|?t]]` ... link to alias anything, but display the tiddler ''title'' ** `[[anything|?c]]` ... link to alias anything, but display the tiddler ''caption'' ** `[[anything|?s]]` ... link to alias anything, but display the tiddler ''subtitle'' ** `[[anything|?my-field]]` ... link to alias anything, but display the tiddler-field named ''my-field'' ** If a field doesn't exist, it shows the "alias-text" as used with `[[anything|?]]` ** using [[aka-makros|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/aka-macros]] for tiddler alias handling * Alias Backlinks ** open the tiddler (i)nfo area: References * Filter Operators: ** `is[alias]` ... extends the core `is` operator see: [[https://tiddlywiki.com/#is Operator]] ** `all[aliases]` ... extends the core `all` operator see: [ext[https://tiddlywiki.com/#all Operator]] ** `[aliasbacklinks[]]` ... shows a list of all tiddlers that contain alias links ** `[[?]aliasbacklinks[]sort[title]]` ... shows a list of tiddlers that contain undefined alias links * Right-Sidebar: More tab: [[Aliases|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/ui/MoreSideBar/Aliases]] ** [[Sorted by Alias|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/ui/MoreSideBar/Aliases/byAlias]] ** [[Sorted by Tiddler Title|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/ui/MoreSideBar/Aliases/byTitle]] ** [[Undefined Aliases|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/ui/MoreSideBar/Aliases/undefined]] * uni-link $:/ControlPanel setting * [[uni-fields|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/uni-fields.js]] widget, that allows us to assign CSS classes based on tiddler fields existence. <<< ! Installation <<< * You can drag & drop import this link: $:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link
<<< ! Link Styling <<< * Uni-links are styled like this: $:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/styles <<< ! Examples <<< You can use the following buttons to create example tiddlers! <> -- <> <<<

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/webdav-lm
name: WegDav lm
description: WebDav PUT saver - takes precedence
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
''Important:'' This plugin takes precedence over the core webDav PUT saver!

This saver uses `last-modified` and `if-unmodified-since` HTTP header attributes, to detect file inconsistencies,
which allows the server to activate server-side file compression. 

The core PUT saver uses etags, which don't work, if server-side file compression is active.
